turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Depends what he told you.  About Bill, you mean?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: All of it. About him, an' you an' Uncle Pete... about robbin' the Rock Island Pacific... an' about them Missouri Banks.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: We done that stuff.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well I guess Bill Munny wasn't no fearless killer an' bank robber like he said.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: He's gonna die, ain't he?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Well, suppose he does?

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: We'll bury him.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: That ain't what I mean.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: You mean, am I gonna help you kill them cowboys?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I can't spot 'em myself but you could. That red-haired one, you could spot a half-mile off, I bet.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: An' if I spot 'em?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I'll ride up close an' shoot 'em!

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Just like that?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I told you I'm a damn killer. I done it before.  I'm more killer than him.

turns.speaker: NED
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Hell, yeah.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Jack. What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: BAER
turns.text: I've been looking all over for you. You still after the coke that walked out of that blood bath in the harbor?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BAER
turns.text: You can stop looking. There was no coke. I've been in L.A. county with a guy they

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: There was ninety-one million -

turns.speaker: BAER
turns.text: We know, but our man says no way on the dope. This Hungarian tells me the whole bunch was pulling stumps for Turkey the next' day. They had no time to negotiate that kind of product and no means to move it.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: What was the money for?

turns.speaker: BAER
turns.text: He didn't know. No one doing the deal knew except a few key people. This guy says they were real hush about it. Whatever it was it was highly sensitive.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: BAER
turns.text: They tell me you got the cripple from New York in there. He mention Keyser Soze

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Who ?

turns.speaker: BAER
turns.text: Bear with me here...

turns.speaker: BAER
turns.text: A boy came across a body on the beach this morning. Thrown clear when the boat burned. Shot once in the head. Two guys from the F.B.I. just identified him.                     +

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: And ?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Keyser Soze

turns.speaker: BAER
turns.text: There's more.

turns.speaker: KOVASH
turns.text: <<We were there to buy a man and take him back to Hungary.>>

turns.speaker: BODI
turns.text: He says they were buying It doesn't make sense. I'm sorry, I'm a little rusty. They were there to buy something.

turns.speaker: BODI
turns.text: Not dope. Something else. Some what?.. He doesn't knob what they were buying. But not dope... people.

turns.speaker: KOVASH
turns.text: <<I'll tell you everything. I'11 even say it slow enough for you to understand it. Just tell this man I want protection. Real protection.>>

turns.speaker: KOVASH
turns.text: <<No, no, no. I need a guarantee from the ridiculous man. I am going to be killed. I have seen the Devil and looked him in the eye.>>

turns.speaker: BODI
turns.text: No good. He needs guarantees. He says... his life is in danger... He has seen the Devil... looked him in the eye.

turns.speaker: KOVASH
turns.text: <<Keyser Soze. Keyser Sate. I've seen his face. I see it when I close my eyes.>>

turns.speaker: BODI
turns.text: He says he knows his face. He sees it when he closes his eyes.

turns.speaker: KOVASH
turns.text: <<It was smaller than that. Sharper.>>

turns.speaker: BODI
turns.text: + The nose is sharper. Smaller too.                          +  <<And what about the hair? You said something earlier about it.>>

turns.speaker: KOVASH
turns.text: <<It is longer than that. And not so dark. >>

turns.speaker: BODI
turns.text: <<Are you sure?>>

turns.speaker: KOVASH
turns.text: <<Don't be stupid.>>

turns.speaker: BODI
turns.text: He says the hair is longer and lighter.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: Now remember, this is another kind of business. They don't earn your respect. You owe it to them. Don't stare them down but don't look away either. Confidence. They are fools not to trust you. That's the attitude.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: I'm having a stroke.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: You've come far. You're a good man. I love you.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: ...and the desk Sergeant is actually trying to tell me he can't release you? Can you believe that? You weren't even charged. New York police - Jesus. I want to take pictures of your face to bring to the D.A. first thing in the morning.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Just forget about it.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: I'11 have this thing in front of a grand jury by Monday.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Edie, please. I don't want to hear this right now. What did Renault and Fortier say?

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: They want more time to think about investing.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Goddamnit.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: They just said they wanted time.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Time for what, Edie? Time to look into me a little more, that's what. No matter how well you cover my tracks now, they'll find out who I am.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: Give me some credit. I got you this far, let's go to the grand jury. This is never going to stop if we -

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: No. It's never going to stop, period. It won't take more than a week before every investor in this city is walking away from us. It's finished. I'm finished.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: Don't give up on me now, Dean.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: They'll never stop.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: They ruined me tonight.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: Dean, I love you. Do you hear me?

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: Come home, Dean.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: That's enough, Edie.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: I don't know what you came here for, but we won't have any part of it.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Edie, please.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: I know who he is.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I hope I didn't disturb you.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: I hope so, too, Mr. Kint. Can I get you something to drink?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: A glass of water would be nice.

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: So what is it you do, Mr. Kint?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Umm ...

turns.speaker: EDIE
turns.text: A hijacker like Dean, here? Or something more creative?

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: I'd say you've gotten on his main and central nerve, McManus.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Do your friend a favor, Fenster, keep him quiet .

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: Forget him. It's not important. I was trying to make a point.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: This whole thing was a shakedown.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: How many times have you been in a line- up? It's always you and four dummies. The P.D. pays homeless guys ten bucks a head half the time. No way they'd line five felons in the same row. No way. And what the hell is a voice line-.up? A public defender could get you off of that.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: So why the hell was I hauled in and cavity searched tonight?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: It was the Feds. A truck load of guns gets snagged, Customs comes down on N.Y.P.D. for some answers - they come up with us. They're grabbing at straws. It's politics - nothing you can do.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: I had a guy's fingers in my asshole tonight.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: Fuck you. I'11 never shit right again. So who did it? Own up.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: I don't want to know.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: This is not right.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: I don't know. Who was that guy that used to talk about Soze in New York?

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: Yeah. He said he did jobs for him. Indirect stuff. Always five times more money than the job was worth.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Come on. The guy is a pipe dream. This Kobayashi is using him for window dressing .

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: I don't know. This is bad.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: You're fuckin' A right, no P.C. Well screw P.C. No right. No goddamn right. You do some time, they never let you go. Treat me like a criminal, I'll end up a criminal.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: You are a criminal.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: Why you gotta go and do that? I'm trying to make a point.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: I'm sure you can understand my hesitation.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: Then who goes?

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: We all go. How about it, Keaton?

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: DON'T MOVE, YOU FUCKERS.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: RIGHT THERE. FREEZE.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: Everybody I ever worked with, did time with.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: They fucking know everything.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: It's bullshit. This guy could be L.A.P.D. I think it's a setup.

turns.speaker: FENSTER
turns.text: The way I hear it, Soze is some kind of butcher. No pity.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: You heard right.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: The word I got is you hung up your spurs, man. What's that all  about?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: He's alright.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: How do I know that? How about it, pretzel-man? What's your story?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: His name is Verbal Kint. I thought you guys knew him.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Why don't you just calm down'

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: What do you care what he says?

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: Keaton, we gotta go. They're gonna find him.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Dig.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: It's a logistical nightmare. Close quarters, no advance layout, ten men, maybe twenty.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: Can we stealth these guys?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Doubtful. With all that coke, they'll be ready - which brings me to sunny spot number two. Even if one of us gets through and jacks the boat, we get nothing.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: I know you. You don't think I know you're on the take. This whole fucking precinct is dirty. You don't have a fucking leg to stand on.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Hockney was just a bad bastard. Good with explosives. Mean as a snake when it mattered .

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Roger really. People say I talk too much.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: Yeah, I was gonna tell you to shut up.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: What are we gonna do?

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: I can run. I got no problem with that.

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Did you hear what he just said?

turns.speaker: HOCKNEY
turns.text: If I'm going in, I want a stake.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: We've met once or twice. Last time was in...

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: County. I was in for fraud.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: You were waiting for a line-up then, too. What happened with that?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I walked. Ninety days, suspended.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: How do you do?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Verb - Roger, this is Edie Finneran. Edie, this is Roger Kint, he was at

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: What the hell do you want?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I wanted to talk to you. The other guys -

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: I did you a favor by standing up for you last night, but don't think we're friends. I'm sorry, but I have other things -

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: They're gonna do a job. Three million dollars, maybe more.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: If you'll just let me -

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Don't hurt me.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Hurt you, you sonofabitch? I could kill you.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: They - That's bullshit. They don't operate anymore.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: McManus has a friend in the Fourteenth Precinct. They're coming out for one job - Thursday. They're picking up a guy smuggling emeralds out of South America. Fenster and McManus have a fence set to take the stuff.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: What fence? Who?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Some guy in California. His name is Redfoot.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Never heard of him.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: You have to come.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: What's with you? What do you care whether I come or not?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: They - They don't know me. You do. They won't take me unless you go. Look at me. I need this.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Tough break.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Don't tell me you don't need this. Is this your place?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: You watch your mouth.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Okay, okay. You say it's the real thing? That's cool.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I was out of line.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I'11 be alright.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Well, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Forget it.  I'11 probably shit blood tonight.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: How are they going to do it?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: McManus wants to go in shooting. I said no way.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Fenster and Hockney?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: They're pretty pissed off. They'll do anything. Now I got a way to do it without killing anyone: but like I said, they won't let me in without you.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Three million?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Maybe more.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: No killing?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Not if we do it my way.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: We'll make it.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Don't do this. Send her a card - something.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: We'll make it.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: What is it Keaton?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Something - I don't know.  I ever tell you about the restaurant I wanted to open?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Who's Keyser Soze?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: What-are they speaking?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Russian, I think. I don't know.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Hungarian?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Keaton, I can't just -

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: I want you to find Edie. Both of you find some place safe. Tell her what happened - Everything. She knows people. She'll know what to do. If we can't get Kobayashi my way, she'll get him her way.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: What if I

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Just do what I tell you.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: How are you, Keaton?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: I'd have to say my spine was broken, Keyser.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Let's say for example -

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: This I had to see myself.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: with what?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You know damn well, dead-man.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Hey, that was your mistake, not mine. Did you ever think to ask me? I've been

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: My employer requires your services. One job. One day's work. Very dangerous. I don't expect all of you to live, but those who do will have ninety-one million dollars to divide any way they see fit.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Who's your boss?

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: My employer wishes to remain anonymous.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Don't jerk me off. We all know what this is. You don't work with me if I work with you without knowing who I'm working for. Now let's cut the shit. Who's the man?

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: I work for Keyser Sate.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: You set up the line-up.

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: Mr. Soze made a few calls, yes. You were not to be released until I came to see you. It seems Mr. Keaton's attorney, Ms. Finneran, was a bit too effective in expediting his release. Holding the rest of you became a moot point.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: What about Redfoot?

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: Mr. Redfoot knew nothing. Mr. Soze rarely                 t works with the same people for very long, and they never know who they're working for. One cannot be betrayed if one has no people.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: The answer is no.

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: Mr. Soze will be most -

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Listen to me, cocksucker. There is no Keyser Sate. If you say his name again, I'11 kill you right here.

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: A strange threat. I can only assume you're here to kill me anyway. Pity about Mr. Redfoot.

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: Ahh, Mr. Hockney. Do join us.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: We know you can get to us, and now you know we can get to you. I'm offering you the chance to call this off.

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: Mr. So- My employer has made up his mind. He does not change it.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Neither do we.

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: I am sorry, Mr. McManus.  f implore you to believe me, Mr. Keaton. Mr. Soze is very real and very                             + determined.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: We'll see.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: Edie Finneran. She is upstairs in my office for an extradition deposition. I requested she be put on the case personally. She flew out yesterday.

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: No matter. Kill away, Mr. McManus.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: You're lying.

turns.speaker: KOBAYASHI
turns.text: Am I? 92 92    INT. HALLWAY - FIFTIETH FLOOR

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: We're on vacation.

turns.speaker: REDFOOT
turns.text: I've got a ton of work and no good people.

turns.speaker: REDFOOT
turns.text: Take your time. Enjoy L.A.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: A friend of mine in New York tells me you knew Spook Hollis.

turns.speaker: REDFOOT
turns.text: I hear you did time with old Spook. Yeah, he was a good egg. I used to run a lot of dope for him. Fuckin' shame he got shivved.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: I shivved him.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Better you hear it from me now than somebody else later.

turns.speaker: REDFOOT
turns.text: Business or personal?

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: A little of both.

turns.speaker: REDFOOT
turns.text: Ain't it a crime? Call if you're interested.

turns.speaker: REDFOOT
turns.text: Get a grip. I didn't know.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: You didn't know.

turns.speaker: REDFOOT
turns.text: The job got thrown to me by this lawyer.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Who is he?

turns.speaker: REDFOOT
turns.text: Some Limey. He's a middle-man for somebody. He doesn't say and I don't ask.

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: We want to meet him.

turns.speaker: REDFOOT
turns.text: He wants to meet you. He called last night and asked me to set it up. What do I tell him'

turns.speaker: KEATON
turns.text: Tell him we'll meet.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: What do you mean I can't see him?

turns.speaker: RAB IN
turns.text: The D.A. came down here last night ready to arraign before they even moved him to county. Kint's lawyer comes in and five minutes later, the D.A. comes out looking like he'd been bitch-slapped by the boogey man. They took his statement and cut him a deal.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Did they charge him with anything?

turns.speaker: RAB IN
turns.text: Weapons. Misdemeanor two.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: What'the fuck is that?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: When does he post bail?

turns.speaker: RAB IN
turns.text: Two hours, tops.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I want to see him.

turns.speaker: RAB IN
turns.text: He won't go into the interrogation room.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Someplace else, then.

turns.speaker: RAB IN
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I know what I wanted to know about Keaton.

turns.speaker: RAB IN
turns.text: Which is shit.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: No matter. He'll have to know how close we came.

turns.speaker: RAB IN
turns.text: Keyser Sate or not, if Keaton's alive he'll never come up again.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I'11 find him.

turns.speaker: RAB IN
turns.text: Waste of time.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: A rumor is not a rumor that doesn't die.

turns.speaker: RAB IN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Nothing. Something I - forget it.

turns.speaker: RABIN
turns.text: Even if I was to let you talk to him, he won't talk to you. He's paranoid about being recorded and he knows the interrogation rooms are wired

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: This won't be an' interrogation, just a... friendly chat to kill time.

turns.speaker: RABIN
turns.text: No, no, no, no, no.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: If it was a dope deal, where's the dope, if it was a hit, who called it in?

turns.speaker: RABIN
turns.text: And I am sure you have a host of wild                   + theories to answer these questions.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: You know damn well what I think.

turns.speaker: RABIN
turns.text: That's crazy, Dave and it doesn't matter. He has total immunity and his story checks out. He doesn't know what you want to know.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I don't think he does. Not exactly, but there's a lot more to his story. I want to know why twenty-seven men died on that pier for what looks to be ninety-one million dollars worth of dope that wasn't there. Above all, I want to be sure that Dean Keaton is dead.

turns.speaker: RABIN
turns.text: His name was Arturo Marquez. A petty smuggler out of Argentina. He was arrested in New York last year for trafficking. He escaped to California and got picked up in Long Beach. They were setting up his extradition when he escaped again. Get this - Edie Finneran was called in to advise the proceedings.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Kobayashi.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Verbal, you know we're trying to help you.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Sure. And I appreciate that. And I want to help you, Agent Kujan. I like cops. I would have liked to have been a Fed myself but my C.P. was -

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Verbal, I know you know something. I know you're not telling us everything.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I told the D.A. everything I know.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I know you liked Keaton I know you think he was a good man.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I know he was good.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: He was a corrupt cop, Verbal.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Sure. Fifteen years ago, but he was a good thief Anyway, the cops wouldn't let him go legit.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Keaton was a piece of shit.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: You trying to get a rise out of me, Agent Kujan?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I just want to hear your story.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: According to your statement you are a short-con operator. Run of the mill seams. Everything you do, you learned from somebody else.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: That's been suppressed. Anything in there is inadmissible.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Oh, I know. Sweet deal you have. Total immunity .

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Well I do have the weapons charge. I'm looking at six whole months hard time.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: You know a dealer named Ruby Deemer, Verbal?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: You know a religious guy named John Paul?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: You know Ruby is in Attica?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: He didn't have my lawyer.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I know Ruby. He's very big on respect. Likes me very much.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: There's nothing in there about Ruby.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I'11 be sure to mention that to him.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: The first thing I learned on the job, know what it was? How to spot a murderer. Let's say you arrest three guys for the same killing. Put them all in jail overnight. The next morning, whoever is sleeping is your man. If you're guilty, you know you're caught, you get some rest - let your guard down, you follow?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I'11 get right to the point. I'm smarter than you. I'11 find out what I want to know and I'11 get it from you whether you like it or not.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I'm not a rat.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Heartwarming. Really, I feel weepy.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: You wanted to know what happened after the line-up, I'm telling you.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Oh come on, Verbal. Who do you think you're talking to? You really expect me to believe he retired? For a woman? Bullshit. He was using her.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: He loved her.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Sure. And I'm supposed to believe that hitting the Taxi Service wasn't his idea

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: That was all Fenster and McManus.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Come on. Keaton was a cop for four years. Who else would know the Taxi Service

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: You keep trying to lay this whole ride on                 t Keaton. It wasn't like that. Sure he knew, but Edie had him all turned around.                 r I'm telling you straight, I swear.                        +

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Let me tell you something. I know Dean Keaton. I've been investigating him for three years. The guy I know is a cold-                    + blooded bastard. L.A.P.D. indicted him on three counts of murder before he was kicked off the force, so don't sell me the hooker with the heart of gold.                        +

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: You got him wrong.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Do I? Keaton was under indictment a total                 + of seven times when he was on the force.                  + In every case, witnesses either reversed                  + their testimony to the grand jury or died                 + before they could testify. When they                      t finally did nail him for fraud, he spent                  + five years in Sing Sing. He killed three prisoners inside - one with a knife in the tailbone while he strangled him to death. Of course I can't prove this but I can't prove the best part either.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I don't know about that.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: I don't think you do. But you say you saw Keaton die. I think you're covering his ass and he's still out there somewhere. I think he was behind that whole circus in the harbor. My bet is he's using you because you're stupid and you think he's your friend. You tell me he's dead, so be it. I want to make sure he's dead before I go back to New York.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: He wasn't behind anything. It was the lawyer.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: What lawyer?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: You think I don't know you held out on the D.A.? What did you leave out of that testimony? I can be on the phone to Ruby Deemer in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: The D.A. gave me immunity.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: NOT FROM ME, YOU PIECE OF SHIT. THERE IS NO IMMUNITY FROM ME. You atone with me or the world you live in becomes the hell you fear in the back of your tiny mind. Every criminal I have put in prison,

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: There was a lawyer. Kobayashi.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Is he the one that killed Keaton?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: No. But I'm sure Keaton's dead.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Convince me. Tell me every last detail. 52    SCENE DELETED                                                              52 53    INT. HOSPITAL - DAY                                                  53                         + Kovash's room is now filled with people. Jack Baer stands next to DANIEL METZHEISER, a balding man in his forties. Next to him is Doctor Plumber. Across from her is Ridgly Waiters.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: So this lawyer...

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Kobayashi.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Came from Redfoot.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: And why leave this out when you talked to the D.A.?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Do you believe in him, Verbal?

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Keaton always said: "I don't believe in God, but I'm afraid of him." Well I believe in God, and the only thing that scares me is Keyser SOZE.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I came clean. I told it like it happened on the boat. So what if I left out how I got there? It's got so many holes in it, the D.A. would've told me to blow amnesty out my ass. So you got what you wanted out of me. Big fucking deal.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: And this is why you never told the D.A.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: You tell me, Agent Kujan. If I told you the Loch Ness Monster hired me to hit the harbor, what would you say?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: Turn state's evidence. Take the stand on this and we'll hear it out.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: I've got immunity now. What can you possibly offer me?

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: If there is a Keyser Soze he'll be looking for you.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Where's your head, Agent Kujan? Where do you think the pressure's coming from? Keyser Soze - or whatever you want to call him - knows where I am right now. He's got the front burner under' your ass to let me go so he can scoop me up ten minutes later. Immunity was just to deal with you assholes. I got a whole new problem when I post bail.

turns.speaker: KUJAN
turns.text: So why play into his hands? We can protect you.

turns.speaker: VERBAL
turns.text: Gee, thanks, Dave. Bang-up job so far. Extortion, coercion. You'll pardon me if I ask you to kiss my pucker. The same fuckers that rounded us up and sank us into this mess are telling me They'll bail me out? Fuck you. You think you can catch Keyser Soze? You think a guy like that comes this close to getting fingered and sticks his head out? If he comes up for anything, it will be to get rid of me.  After that, my guess is you'll never hear from him again.
